content: Search Free Trial Get Demo Authorize.Net Authorize.net is an online payment gateway that allows sellers to accept credit card and electronic payments over the phone, in a brick-and-mortar storefront or online. The amount is deposited automatically in the bank account of the merchant. It is a stress free way to secure and streamline the payment process. WHY AUTHORIZE.NET? Authorize.net allows sellers to accept a variety of payment options such as eChecks, major credit cards, signature debit cards, Pay pal, gift cards, and different forms of digital payments via their website A merchant interface to monitor and manage transactions through websites. It has a fraud prevention system with fraud detection tools and filters that identify suspicious transactions Sensitive and confidential data is never stored on users computer. Only Authorize.Net PCI-compliant data center has such data stored. Payments received quickly with funds automatically transferred to the retailers bank accounts It stores the payment, billing and customer shipping information so that the returning customers do not have to re-enter this information every time. It also makes the billing process more secure and efficient. Credit cards stored in the system are automatically updated when they are expired to prevent lost sales and interruptions in payment process Account and technical support is provided to sellers along with user guides Company Partners Resources Investor Relations Products Freeware Demo Solutions Contact Us Privacy Management Service by Data443
analysis:
Here is a detailed analysis of the product security features described for Authorize.Net:

1. Key security features and capabilities
- PCI-compliant data center for securely storing sensitive payment and customer data
- Fraud prevention system with detection tools and filters to identify suspicious transactions 
- Automatic credit card updating to prevent interruptions when cards expire
- Securely stores payment, billing and shipping info so customers don't have to re-enter

2. User benefits and protection measures  
- Merchants can securely accept a wide variety of payment types online, by phone, and in-person
- Customer data is never stored on the merchant's systems, only in Authorize.Net's secure data center
- Fraud tools help protect merchants from fraudulent transactions and chargebacks
- Tokenized storage of payment data simplifies PCI compliance for merchants
- Returning customers enjoy a more streamlined checkout process

3. Integration with existing security systems
- Details not provided, but as a payment gateway Authorize.Net likely integrates with common ecommerce platforms and security tools
- Fraud detection probably leverages data from across Authorize.Net's merchant base

4. Compliance and certification details
- Authorize.Net maintains a PCI-compliant data center for storing sensitive data
- No other specific compliance or security certifications are mentioned

5. Security best practices for users
- Merchants should never store customer payment data on their own systems
- Enable available fraud detection tools and review transactions for signs of fraud
- Keep Authorize.Net account credentials secure and restrict access to authorized users
- Comply with PCI requirements for securing the payment environment 

6. Technical specifications and requirements
- Technical specs and system requirements for integrating Authorize.Net are not detailed
- As a hosted payment gateway, merchants likely integrate via API or hosted payment pages
- Supports online, mobile, phone and in-person payment acceptance

In summary, Authorize.Net provides a secure, PCI-compliant platform for merchants to accept payments while minimizing their handling of sensitive data. Built-in fraud prevention, secure data storage, and automatic card updating help protect both merchants and their customers. However, specific technical details, certifications, and integration options are not fully covered in the description provided.
